intro: Sideroxylon cuspidatum var. micranthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ironwood, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and the plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or dry forest habitats.
